title: Washer drum not spinning but machine turns on
symptoms: Washer powers on but drum does not spin at all
You can hear a humming sound but no movement
Clothes come out completely wet
possible_causes: Defective lid switch (top-load) or door lock (front-load)
recommended_actions: Unplug the washer and check if the drum can be turned by hand. If it spins freely, belt might be broken
Inspect the back cover (if safe) to see if the belt is off the pulleys
Make sure the lid/door is closing properly and listen for click of the safety switch
If belt and lid switch look good, call a professional to test the motor and control board

title: Washer not draining water at the end of cycle
symptoms: Water remains in the drum after cycle finishes
Washer may show drain error code
Clothes are soaking wet and heavy
recommended_actions: Locate and clean the drain pump filter (usually behind small access door in front-bottom)
Check the drain hose for kinks or clogs and ensure it is not inserted too far into the standpipe
Listen during drain: if you hear no pump sound, pump motor may be bad
If cleaning does not help, contact a technician to test/replace the drain pump

title: Washer making loud banging noise during spin
symptoms: Strong banging or knocking sound in spin cycle
Machine may walk or move across the floor
Excessive vibration felt through the cabinet
possible_causes: Load out of balance (heavy items on one side)
Worn suspension rods or shock absorbers
Washer not level on the floor
recommended_actions: Pause the cycle, open the door, and redistribute clothes evenly around the drum
Make sure the washer is level front-to-back and side-to-side, adjust legs if needed
If noise continues even with small balanced load, suspension or shocks may need replacement
Call a technician if you suspect broken counterweight or internal damage

title: Washer door locked and will not open
symptoms: Cycle is finished but door stays locked
Error code related to door or lock
You hear clicking but latch does not release
possible_causes: Control board not sending unlock signal
Water not fully drained from washer
Child lock or safety mode still active
recommended_actions: Wait a few minutes after cycle in case of delayed unlock
Perform a power reset: unplug for 2–3 minutes then plug back in
Check if there is water remaining; run a drain/spin cycle
If still locked, consult manual for emergency release cable or call a professional

title: Washer smells like mold or mildew
symptoms: Strong musty smell inside drum
Clothes come out with bad odor even after washing
Black or slimy residue on rubber door seal
possible_causes: Mold growth in door boot seal (front-loaders)
recommended_actions: Run a hot wash with washer-cleaner product or white vinegar + baking soda (without clothes)
Carefully wipe and scrub the rubber door seal, removing any visible mold
Leave the door and detergent drawer slightly open between uses to dry out
Switch occasionally to hot or sanitize cycles to kill bacteria

title: Washer leaking water from front or door
symptoms: Water puddle in front of washer
Drips visible from door area during wash
Leak worse during high-speed spin
possible_causes: Damaged or dirty door boot seal
Loose door glass clamp or retainer
Too much detergent causing excess suds
recommended_actions: Inspect the door seal for tears, foreign objects, or buildup and clean it thoroughly
Reduce detergent amount and use HE (high-efficiency) detergent if required
Remove and clean the detergent drawer and housing
If seal is torn or leak persists, door gasket likely needs replacement by a professional

title: Washer fills very slowly or not at all
symptoms: Cycle starts but tub fills extremely slowly
Error for low water or no fill
Only hot or only cold water works
possible_causes: Partially blocked inlet screens at water valves
Closed or partially closed household shutoff valves
recommended_actions: Check that both hot and cold water faucets are fully open
Turn off water and disconnect hoses to clean inlet screens
Test if problem happens on both hot and cold settings; if one side fails, valve coil may be bad
If other fixtures also have weak flow, contact a plumber for pressure issue

title: Washer overfilling or not stopping water
symptoms: Water level rises too high
Washer may overflow onto floor
Cycle does not advance to wash
possible_causes: Blocked air tube to pressure switch
Control board not shutting valve off
recommended_actions: Immediately turn off water supply faucets if overfilling occurs
Unplug washer to stop any electrical control
Have a professional inspect pressure switch, air hose, and inlet valve
Do not continue using the washer until the cause is repaired

title: Washer leaving detergent residue on clothes
symptoms: White streaks or powder left on dark clothing
Detergent clumps seen in drum after wash
Residue more noticeable in cold washes
possible_causes: Too much detergent used per load
Detergent not dissolving fully in cold water
recommended_actions: Reduce detergent amount, especially for HE washers
Use warmer water or pre-dissolve powdered detergent in hot water
Avoid overloading; leave space for clothes to tumble freely
Clean the detergent drawer and its water channels regularly

title: Washer stops mid-cycle and does not continue
symptoms: Machine pauses and stays stuck at certain time
No error code or only generic one
You may hear relay clicks but no action
possible_causes: Faulty door/ lid switch intermittently losing contact
recommended_actions: Check if opening/closing door causes cycle to resume — if yes, door lock may be weak
Unplug washer for a few minutes then restart the cycle
Avoid running repeated heavy loads back-to-back that can overheat the motor
If problem repeats at same stage, a technician should test control board and sensors
